medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset right upper quadrant and right flank pain, and nausea/vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started at 5 AM this morning. The patient describes the pain as intermittent, with unspecified intensity, and reports vomiting six times since this morning in small volume, mostly mucus. Last bowel movement was this morning and was soft. This type of pain has happened to him several years ago.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Marfan's syndrome, hypertension, arthritis, benign prostatic hyperplasia, high cholesterol, low testosterone. Past surgical history includes distal superficial femoral artery to below-knee popliteal bypass, popliteal artery aneurysm resection, aorto-bi-iliac Dacron graft with ligation of internal iliacs bilaterally, and Bentall procedure for Type A dissection with mechanical valve placement.
